channel.title: Maximebiloe on PrestaShop Developers' blog
channel.description: Recent content in Maximebiloe on PrestaShop Developers' blog

item.title: Parent/Child theme feature in PrestaShop 1.7
item.description: There is a feature introduced in PrestaShop 1.7.0 that we would like to dive back in: the child theme feature!

item.title: Contribute to the UI kit of the 1.7 back office
item.description: PrestaShop is 10 years old this year. 10 years and a software that have experienced 7 major evolutions.

item.title: How we're introducing Vue JS & a Symfony API
item.description: If you follow the Core Weekly or our recent GitHub activity, you may have seen that we introduced a new front-end technology in the PrestaShop back office: Vue.js. So, let’s talk a little about it to see what’s coming up.

item.title: Release of PrestaShop 1.6.1.14
item.description: PrestaShop 1.6.1.14 is now available. This maintenance release has seen 21 pull requests merged since version 1.6.1.13.

item.title: Release of PrestaShop 1.7.0.3
item.description: PrestaShop 1.7.0.3 is now available. This maintenance release closes 28 of the most pressing issues reported since v1.7.

item.title: PrestaShop 1.7 & performances
item.description: With PrestaShop 1.7, our main purposes were to improve the user experience on the Product Creation page and the Modules page, and also to make it easier to create a front office theme.

item.title: Evolution of the PrestaShop Coding Standards
item.description: Working on an open source project as massive as the PrestaShop codebase, a few ground rules have long been established in order to ease the participation of developers, be they from the PrestaShop Core team or the Community at large.

item.title: Here comes PrestaShop 1.7.0.0 alpha 4!
item.description: Three weeks ago we released PrestaShop 1.7.0.0 alpha 3. Since then, and with the help of the community, we’ve been working on it to fix the bugs you’ve reported and to keep improving this new version. We’re now releasing PrestaShop 1.7.0.0 alpha 4 version, so we can keep gathering feedback and make sure that the final and stable version will be the best it can be!

item.title: New default theme for PrestaShop 1.7
item.description: The first beta version for PrestaShop 1.7 is approaching quickly, so we have started to work on the new 1.7 default theme, currently named “He who must be named” — tentatively named “classic” for now, for lack of a better name :) It is based on the Starter Theme that we’ve been telling you about here on Build — what best way to test what we’ve been working on for a while?

item.title: Starter Theme: fresh news from the front #3
item.description: It’s been a while since we gave you any news about the StarterTheme. So, let’s sum up what happened since Starter Theme: Fresh News From The Front #2.
